summary: A proxy website that allows users to browse the web anonymously by routing requests through the server.
architectural_notes: Server-side proxy: all requests are forwarded server-side to avoid CORS issues
Response rewriting: HTML links, forms, and resource URLs must be rewritten to stay within the proxy
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimalist neon-green globe icon on a dark background, flat vector style (proxy-logo.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Build a frontend UI with a URL input field and a 'Go' / 'Browse' button. When submitted, the entered URL is sent to the backend proxy function and the returned content is displayed in a sandboxed iframe or a scrollable content area.
Rewrite relative links, images, stylesheets, and script src attributes in the proxied HTML response so they route back through the proxy, enabling multi-hop browsing.

Apply a cohesive dark terminal/hacker aesthetic with a monospace font, neon accent color (e.g. green or cyan on near-black), clean card layout for the input bar, and consistent styling across all UI elements.

new_feature_requests.summary: Proxy request routing - forward user requests through the server to target URLs
URL input interface - simple UI for entering the target website URL
Response rewriting - rewrite links and resources in proxied pages to route through the proxy
Implement a backend Motoko actor that accepts a target URL as input, fetches the content of that URL via HTTP outcalls, and returns the response body as text to the frontend.
